intro: Odontites triboutii, commonly known as the Alpine toothplant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, fern-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in early summer. Odontites triboutii thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and slopes. It is a hardy perennial that is adapted to cold climates and high altitudes.
